WRITING.TEXT:
Yay!
https://imgur.com/a/yWwVC

There would be no issues with artisans sending their products as gifts (so to answer your question no there is no problem with you sending your USBs as gifts). I don't know if reddit gifts would host this exchange, but if they did the minimum reddit gifts gift value is $20 but if I end up hosting it then there would be no minimum gift value, just give what your happy to give without expecting to get a gift of equal or greater value in return.
I have just emailed reddit gifts asking how I would go about getting a mechanical keyboards gift exchange on reddit gifts. Hopefully I will get a reply back tommorow.

If I end up contacting reddit gifts and they approve my request for a mechanical keyboards gift exchange then the set amount would be $20 which is the "standard" reddit gifts minimum recommend spend. But if I would have to end up hosting it myself here on r/MK then I would say "just spend as much as your happy to spend without expecting to receive an equal or greater gift in return (for example if your happy to spend $50 on a gift and wouldn't care if you got a $20 gift in return then do it but if you are only doing it to get a $50+ gift in return then don't do it)".
Maybe $50 would be more appropriate?
$20 minimum gift value (not including shipping). Someone collects all of the participants information and randomly matches to another user.

WRITING.TITLE: r/MK Should do a secret santa gift exchange
WRITING.TEXT: Would anyone else be down for this?
I need to update the sets and get another quote done, Thanks for reminding me about the novelties, I forgot to get a quote done last time so i will make sure that it get done this time
Fair enough.

Maybe these are more spare keys instead of manufacturing rejects like the last round of "crap bags"?
EDIT: I read the description of the product and it said something about winning a $150 gift card or something. So yeah it's probably still all "crap" like last time.
I guess that makes sense, but as a whole it would make more sense for it to be called something like "not safe in public" or something along those lines.
But shouldn't you actually be doing your job instead of browsing reddit?

WRITING.TITLE: If the whole point of work is to be working, then why would people on sites like reddit need to have a "not safe for work" button?

WRITING.TEXT:
I have fixed the form issue, so please feel free to use it now :)
The reason for this seperation is to make sure that 60% users don't have to pay $100 for a kit that should only be costing them around $60. Here are the two quotes so that you can see the price differences: [original](http://i.imgur.com/rDIeJQJ.jpg) [current](http://i.imgur.com/wastssL.jpg) the original sets had the same base but the mods supported tkl and 100%, but meant that 60% users had to pay full price and have an extra 40 keys that they had no use for.
Hope this clears some things up.

Thanks for your suggestion. I can see where your coming from in terms of not having to pay for extra keys, but if I include the extra Planck alpha keys in the base set, then all the "standard" 60/80/100% users are paying extra for keys that they would not normally be using. I'm going to have to modify some of the sets any way so I will do just a Planck mods set along with a modified base set and get a quote from signtaure plastics to see the price difference, if any.
Good idea! I will go fix that :)
I will go fix that :)
Fixed :)
Thanks :)

Hi, Thanks for your feedback!
I contacted Massdrop a few weeks back and they replied saying that if sales wanted to sell this set then they would get back to me, but I still haven't gotten a reply. So I will probably end up having to run it myself either on Geekhack or here.
-Joshua

WRITING.TITLE: Mint. DSA (update post)
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey r/MK, You may or may not have seen my IC, so if you haven't heres the link: https://www.reddit.com/r/MechanicalKeyboards/comments/549hs6/ic_mint_dsa/
Well, between here and Geekhack, I have received a bit of interest for the kit, So I have sent a quote to Signature Plastics, and when I get the quote back I will hopefully do a group buy.
So, I am wondering if anyone here has ever done a group buy on either here or mass drop, and would be wiling to tell me how you set up a group buy.
Thanks r/MK for all of your feedback and comments.
-Joshua
